title: Benavidez blasts out warning
text:
Frampton vs Santa Cruz II: David Benavidez stops Sherali Mamajonov in second round By Tim Hobbs Last Updated: 29/01/17 7:51am Hard-hitting super-middleweight David Benavidez showed his power, stopping Sherali Mamajonov in two rounds. 
The 20-year-old, who stands at 6ft 2in, put his opponent down in each round, before the referee stepped in to move him to 17-0-KO16 and fire a warning out to the 168lbs scene. 
Benavidez made a steady start before exploding 10 seconds from the end of the opening round, a left to the body then a straight right leaving Mamajonov down. David Benavidez moved to 17-0 with another impressive win 
It took just 50 seconds of the second to finish the job, a brilliant combination of two lefts downstairs, a right to the head and then a perfect left hook, forcing the second knockdown. 
Mamajonov did well to get up, only for referee Russell Mora to wave it off. Ivan Redkach (r) stopped Demond Brock in the final round 
Ivan Redkach returned to winning ways with a last-round stoppage of Demond Brock. 
The Ukrainian lightweight had a draw and a defeat in his last two fights and was given a tough time by the American known as 'Body Shot'. 
Redkach landed the clearer punches early on, but spent a large chunk on the ropes, and had to dig deep to force the stoppage before the final bell. Also See:
